verse: भृगुर्वै वारुणिः। वरुणं पितरमुपससार। अधीहि भगवो ब्रह्मेति। तस्मा एतत् प्रोवाच। अन्नं प्राणं चक्षुः श्रोत्रं मनो वाचमिति।तं होवाच। यतो वा इमानि भूतानि जायन्ते। येन जातानि जीवन्ति। यत् प्रयन्त्यभिसंविशन्ति। तद्विजिज्ञासस्व। तद्‌ ब्रह्मेति। स तपोऽतप्यत। स तपस्तप्त्वा॥

terms.वारुणिः: Vāruṇiḥ (the son of Varuṇa, referring to Bhṛgu)

meaning: Meaning:Bhṛgu, the son of Varuṇa, approached his father Varuṇa and said, "O revered one, teach me about the Supreme Being." Varuṇa then replied, "This is what I will tell you: Food, vital energy, eyes, ears, mind, and speech. These are the means through which all beings are born, live, and depart. Inquire about that Supreme Being. That Supreme Being is attained through austerity. After performing the austerity..."
